data.title: Boun appetito!
data.text: Best Italian joint in town. There's Pietros in town but they seem to cater more to families which is fine. Fuso is Vacavilles Little Italy. I used that word lightly. It has all the basic Italian flair which can be paired with above average wine. If you want "fine" Italian dining and don't want to spend too much, check this place out. Otherwise, head to Napa and check out UVA or Don Giovanni. Ciao!!

data.title: Private banquet room a bonus for events
data.text: We already really liked this restaurant, so when we needed a private room for a family event we were happy they had one available. We had a buffet lunch and round tables for 42 people. The food was excellent as the service. There is a flat screen TV available to show your own slide show. Only tricky part was the street parking that was listed as 2 hours. Though the restaurant assured us that it is not often enforced, many people left after the two hours.

data.title: Great late lunch into Happy Hour
data.text: We had a late lunch, and it went to the start of Happy Hour. Leilani (?) a delightful bartender. Great food, drink, served with a bubbling personality.

data.title: Attractive setting and good food.
data.text: We had an early dinner here on a Saturday night.  The restauarant was quite busy, but we had reservations and were seated right away.  Our server was friendly and attentive, and the food came out quickly.  I had the gnocchi, which was excellent.  My daughter and husband enjoyed their entrees, too; both of them had pasta dishes.  The dining room is very attractive, with a wine country type of vibe, even if it is in downtown Vacaville.  The service was quite good until we were finished with our meal; we had a bit of a wait for our check.  Speaking of the check, the restaurant is a bit pricy, but the servings are large, and we had leftovers to take home.  Overall, though, it was very pleasant meal.

data.title: Unfriendly and rude
data.text: I had made reservations for four and they wanted to seat us at a table right at the entrance with a very narrow passage to the restaurant which was almost empty. I told the waitress that we would like to have a better table in the back which she complied with. Then we waited a long time before we even got the menu. In the meantime, the wait staff was involved entertaining another group of people sitting at a big table close to the bar and totally ignored us. We finally had enough of their lousy attitude and left the restaurant. The waitress then said: "Sorry it didn't work out for you." Too little too late for us. We will never go there again.

data.title: Yummy with an extra Yumm!
data.text: This place is so nice. The inside has beautiful decor. The staff is friendly and courteous. The food is very delicious. Not for on a budget though. They have a nice selection of fine wines. Everything we've ordered here has been exceptional and the serving size great. A wonderful place to have a drink and apps with friends new and old.

data.title: Ambiance is good; food is a huge disappointment.  Am I missing something?
data.text: I have eaten here twice and been extremely disappointed.  The prices are high, and the food is very oily and processed tasting.  Nothing I've had tastes fresh.  It all tastes like it has been frozen or canned and pre-prepared.  I am so confused by the high ratings.  The wait staff is sweet and attentive, and the ambiance is nice, but I would rather spend my money elsewhere.  I know people who go for the happy hour menu -- maybe I'll try that.  But never again for dinner.

data.title: Good Food, Nice place...a little pricey
data.text: We've eaten here several times and have always had a nice meal here.  It's good for a special meal....ie:  holiday....date... etc.  It's a little on the pricey side for my taste, so we don't go often.

data.title: Calamari Dore
data.text: The calamari dore will melt in your mouth. The atmosphere is very good too. Usually there is enough parking but if cant get street parking there is a lot at the library which is really close. I have eaten there numerous time and take friends when have friends in from out of town. Highly recommended.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Fuso is a nice place to eat.  Vacaville really doesn't have what I would consider fine dining, but Fuso is a nice place to eat.  The service is good, and the quality of your meal is good as well.

data.title: Sweet date night
data.text: We were given a gift certificate to this restaurant and it was a real treat.  Our food was delicious and the service was excellent.   The sangria was also very good.  Will definitely return.

data.title: Nice atmospjere
data.text: Went to meet a business associate for a meeting.  We had an app, the calamari and some Chardonnay.  The wait staff could describe the different wines well and she gave us a taste to try before buying.  This was nice.  Calamari was great.

data.title: Best Italian in Vacaville
data.text:
Excellent food and service. Great place for Birthday celebrations!
Fettuccini Alfredo with chicken was/is my favorite dish, but for dessert:
The Tiramisu was super.

data.title: Im italian but didnt like this food
data.text:
Not sure why so many locals like this place. Im italian and picky perhaps but travel the world for work so know a bit about great food. Both times i went, had fettaccine and just didnt like it. 

Nice atmosphere and staff but high priced and mediocre food.

data.title: Pleasant (Dinner) Find  in Vacaville, Californial!!!
data.text: Based upon TripAdvisor reviews, we thought we'd give Fuso a try... what a pleasant dining experience!  The menu was varied, the food was exceptional, and our server was efficient, helpful and most pleasant!  We would highly recommend Fuso for really tasty and generous food portions for a very enjoyable Italian dinner!

data.title: Lots to choose from
data.text: My favorite is the cobb salad.  The selection is good from light to full meals.  A full bar and some weekends have bands.  Plan on spending time here, they don't rush.

data.title: ALWAYS GREAT
data.text: Husband got ribeye,  I go carbonara. Both magnificent. Ate at bar with Lelani, a superb bartender and lovely person. If you like Italian and/or steak, this place rocks.

data.title: 60th Birthday celebration dinner!
data.text: Not impressed with the service! The birthday girl should of been the first one to get a drink. Her and her husband wanted to share a bottle of wine. Everyone got served and the server then came around to take the dinner orders. Wait a minute what about the bottle of wine?  We were there a good 30 minutes before she got served. I was kind embarrassed that I had a glass of wine and she didn't. I am in catering and have always catered to the person in honor. Doesn't matter what the occasion! It was nice that at the end of dinner they brought out dessert menus and a birthday treat for the birthday girl.  Didn't even come back to take dessert orders or what about coffee? The bill came and that was the end of that.

data.title: Fine dining in Downtown Vacaville---REALLY!
data.text: There are many restaurants with "good" food in Vacaville, but Fuso's is definitely in a class by itself.  The dining room is in a smaller, quiet room behind the bar and there is an area for al fresco dining in nice weather. The cuisine is Northern Italian with some American food choices and it's terrific in both taste and portion size.  Server was attentive, but not intrusive.  The restaurant is nicely decorated with old world styling including faux stone columns---reminiscent of a small restaurant in Rome or Florence.  Open kitchen design is a nice touch;  enjoyable to watch the chef preparing your meal as you watch.  In my opinion, Fuso's is the only really "fine dining" restaurant in Vacaville.  Highly recommended!

data.title: Local Restaurant Has it All!
data.text:
This is one of our favorite restaurants in Vacaville.  We have dinner once a month with
friends.. The restaurant has a small, intimate feeling and nice atmosphere.  The quiet setting lends itself to private conversations with your guests.  They also have an outdoor area for eating along with portable heaters if needed.  It's great to sit outdoors or inside.  The food includes a variety of European cuisine, including Italian and French.  Their American dishes are also quite tasty. .We've never been disappointed with the food or service. The prices vary with the entrees one orders.  We like to go on Sunday evenings and the staff allows us to linger at dinner..  Also, they serve after dinner aperitifs and flavored coffee drinks.  If you can fit it in, we sometimes share a dessert(s) with each other.  I love their tiramisu! .
